website_summaries.verdict: A highly dependable digital clock that's easy to read, functions indoors and out, and provides date and temperature information for your convenience.
pros: For the ultimate in accuracy, this clock syncs with United States Government National Institute
Can be mounted on a wall or displayed on a table or shelf
cons: Must also find a place for the receiving unit, though the clock can be placed anywhere within 100 feet of it

customer_reviews.title: The clock is not as big as the product information or the photo showed.
customer_reviews.text: This rating is not about the quality of the product. The rating is because of the false advertisement. The product description says its dimension is 13 x 11 inches, but the clock I received is only 8.5 x 8 inches. It seems that the product description is based on the dimension of the package instead of the product itself. This is very misleading and annoying, and I decided to return the product. Later on I checked the Q&A section of this product. There it mentioned the true dimension. I don't understand why can't they just update the product information with the real product dimension.
customer_reviews.author: disappointed nerd

customer_reviews.title: Overall, a good clock, but....
customer_reviews.text: ... the outdoor temperature sensor keeps losing connection. Its placed within line of sight of the clock, so theres no obstructions. Changed channels and still it loses connection after a few days. Tried new batteries now 3 times and still the malfunction.
customer_reviews.author: M. F

customer_reviews.title: Won't show outside temperature.
customer_reviews.text: The time display is large, so easy to read. I've had it less than a week and already given up on the outside temperature feature.
customer_reviews.author: Pettifogger

customer_reviews.title: The product is not an "atomic" clock.
customer_reviews.text: In the product description, the manufacturer claims that the clock receives signals from the agency in Colorado that maintains the atomic clock and is therefore highly accurate because it always displays the "atomic" time. The clock I received has never done this. The display is also deficient. The product is not what it purports to be.
customer_reviews.author: Eric R. Hansen

customer_reviews.title: The clock works fine but...
customer_reviews.text: This clock has two thermometers, one internal for the inside temperature and one external for the outside temperature. It is the latter which does not function but approximately half the time. The clock works fine but the external thermometer sure needs help.
customer_reviews.author: PhotoGene47

customer_reviews.title: Big numbers and thought it lite up to see the numbers at nite.
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed. I thought it would lite up so I could see it at night. Very disappointed. That why I bought the big numbers and was to lite up at nite.
customer_reviews.author: John McAvay

customer_reviews.title: outdoor temp doesn't always work
customer_reviews.text: The display is smaller that my old clock and is hard to read in dim light. I used new fresh batteries and the outdoor temperature stops displaying for days at a time then starts working. Exactly what the old clock did despite fresh batteries. I have the sensor set about 5 feet away and near a window too.
customer_reviews.author: littlemad

customer_reviews.title: Good looking and accurate
customer_reviews.text: Everything worked great after I got new batteries in it. Initially I put some used batteries in it and the outside temp wouldn't work. Worked great with new batteries. I like the fact that it has several channels, so you can change channels if your neighbor has one. Time is easy to read from across the room. Temperature is OK to read from 10 to 15 feet. Totally accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis E.

customer_reviews.title: Poor manufacturing or design
customer_reviews.text: The design or manufacture of this item is defective. The batteries in the clock do not connect. Therefore, the product does not work.
customer_reviews.author: jala

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't do what it is supposed to
customer_reviews.text: The clock never linked to the atomic clock. The outdoor temperature sensor never linked. It at least kept time for about 60 days and then malfunctioned. Now it constantly flashes between the two attached pictures. This is not my first atomic clock but it is the first from Sharp. We have two other brand clocks around the house. ADDITIONAL INFO: The clock stopped working completely after about 60 days. It just went blank. Tested the batteries and they were all in good condition.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Need light.
customer_reviews.text: A very nice clock, easy to set and read except at night. I am considering sending this back because it does not light up at nig
customer_reviews.author: Gerald Cornelli

customer_reviews.title: Dead
customer_reviews.text: Recently purchased and received Sharp's Atomic Clock Model # = PC1107. Following instructions using new batteries, each testing 1.5 VDC, the clock remains totally dead. I wrote to their published Customer Service [custserv_clocks@mzb.com] but did not get a reply. I have a useless dead clock.
customer_reviews.author: John Q. Donicker

customer_reviews.title: Looks good outside temperature did not work
customer_reviews.text: Looks good outside temperature did not work. So had to return it. Bought the LaCrosse brand and it's readings are very accurate.
customer_reviews.author: LB

customer_reviews.title: Not worth buying
customer_reviews.text: I like the size of the numbers etc. but this clock DOES NOT transmit the outdoor temps for longer than 24 hrs. After about 24 hrs the temp reading goes to dashes. You have to remove all batteries from clock & transmitter to get it going again & then after appx 24 hr it's gone again. Also during the day the hour on the clock flashes intermittently back & forth between EST & PST. I am truly disappointed in this item.
customer_reviews.author: J. M. D.

customer_reviews.title: Be Prepared
customer_reviews.text: Before you order this, you should know that you will need specialized tools--a very small Phillips screwdriver (small enough to use on eyeglasses) to open the sending unit, and a thin but rigid piece of wire, to push the reset button (which Sharp says to do, although it is not really necessary). Have these on hand before the unit arrives.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Tainter

customer_reviews.title: Clock not receiving the correct time and outdoor sensor temp not received.
customer_reviews.text: The outdoor temperature sensor not working. Sensor light blinks but the clock never receives temp. All receive channels tried. Also, clock repeatedly gets the wrong time for a few hours then may later correct itself, only to do it again the next night. Other than never being sure the right time is displayed and the outdoor sensor not working even when inches away from the clock, it is a nice large numeral display clock.
customer_reviews.author: Caster

customer_reviews.title: Nice Clock
customer_reviews.text: Pretty nice clock, I have the remote set outside and it seems to be pretty accurate. The Atomic Clock auto-set feature has never worked though, I have tried everything to get it to sync up with the radio signal. It just will not work, it shows it is receiving a signal and a decent one but the time never sets correctly... I was hoping for the ability to just leave the clock ad it would set its self as needed but it will not. Other than that I have o issues with this clock. I would still recommend it
customer_reviews.author: G. Fox

customer_reviews.title: Does not work correctly
customer_reviews.text: The clock looks great but I have never been able to get the transmitter to work for the outside temperature. I have tried it in several locations to no avail. I even placed the transmitter beside the clock and it still did not show the temperature. I have sent two emails to the seller and have yet to get a response. I would not recommend purchasing this clock!
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Atomic Clock Size and pricing
customer_reviews.text: Shipped in Amazon Box. The digital widows were all covered with plastic protective covering. To start the atomic clock search press the wave button, a small blinking dot on dispaly shows the wave was on. Then Atomic clock automatically was set after midnight. Do not believe the photo size showing a very large clock behind the couch. Actual measurements are 8" X 8-3/4". Clock time LCD is as stated 3 inches High. New price was $39.25 on Feb. 7, 2020 and I just checked lowest price today it is $53.99! Feb 13, 2020. What is going on with $14 price increase?
customer_reviews.author: Happy Howie

customer_reviews.title: It's the remote
customer_reviews.text: The clock hangs next to me on my front porch. Morning coffee and the morning breeze with a periodic glance at the time. I love it. The remote is a different story. You need tiny tools to get the screw out and even tinier tools to open the case to insert the batteries. After several attempts, I got the remote assembled but it's not talking to the clock. The remote is a minor addition and I'm sure they'd say, "It's a user problem." The clock is a great value and easy to read. The remote? "Oh, well."
customer_reviews.author: Wauwatosa

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend purchasing
customer_reviews.text: I had to exchange the first one I bought as within the first week the outside temperature feature stopped working, half of the time numbers were faded away and I couldn’t read the time and then the atomic feature kept glitching out. The second one is not showing the outside temperature either anymore but the time is still legible. Would not purchase again
customer_reviews.author: Darius

customer_reviews.title: The packaging as described in the review.
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement clock for one that I have had for years that was very hard to set/operate. I decided on the Sharp and found it to be so easy to set and use, however, the plastic face edge (black) wasn't covered with plastic and the box had no lid or cover over it. As a result there are numerous scratches on the black plastic edge. In my opinion this is a packaging problem as the clock runs great. Helen Whitehouse
customer_reviews.author: Helen Whitehouse

customer_reviews.title: Not so great
customer_reviews.text: The clock works great but the outdoor temp does not send a signal. After working via email with the company it still doesn’t work. I would say this is out of date and not a very lovely decoration for the wall. My daughter is disabled and temperature is important to her for understanding how to dress so I thought this would be nice. Oh well.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: TIME FOR A CHANGE...
customer_reviews.text: This is the BEST CLOCK....I had a clock similar to this one years ago. I always had trouble setting the TIME ZONE, THE CLOCK TIME, THE MINUTES...I have to admit, the clock went to the yard sale. I ordered this clock because I Like having the ability to see the time, the temperature and when DST comes and goes, I do not want to SET UP all over again...I just installed the batteries to the clock and the remote, put the remote on the window sill, put the clock nearby and went to bed. My eyes opened to the Clock already set and every setting was correct...It is like Santa was here...
customer_reviews.author: Jae Vonn

customer_reviews.title: Works quite well
customer_reviews.text: I am using this clock in my bathroom, where at times I don't have my glasses on, so the large digits are really nice. When I first set it up, I intentionally set the time about 25 seconds fast, so it would be obvious that the WWVB receiver has accurately set the time. Sure enough, the next morning, the time was corrected. The outdoor temperature sensor shows a degree or two higher than my Davis weather station, but frankly, I don't really care - that's not what I bought it for. It's close enough.
customer_reviews.author: Jim W.

customer_reviews.title: Updated version?
customer_reviews.text: After reading the reviews about signal reception and viewing angle, I decided to take a chance. I’m happy to report that the viewing angle is excellent, maybe 80 degrees off center up/down and side. Good in bright or dim light as a wall clock. Also, I live east of Cleveland, Ohio and the time synced right up at 1:30PM when the signal is supposed to be the weakest from Colorado. The only gripe is that the plastic is really cheap and flimsy. Cleaning it will be a delicate process.
customer_reviews.author: John C. Homer

customer_reviews.title: Outdoor temperature transmitter failed
customer_reviews.text: Just after the 30 day return period, the outdoor temperature transmitter failed and showed readings that were approximately 20 degrees high. I do not recommend this clock.
customer_reviews.author: Karl P.

customer_reviews.title: nice clock, outside temp non functional
customer_reviews.text: Finding a clock that shows military time and was reasonably priced turned out to be a pain. The extra features, atomic clock, indoor temp, date, outdoor temp, were not what I was looking for. The fact that the outdoor temp never worked did not make it worthwhile to send it back. UPDATE: After using clock I decided I liked the extra features and wanted the outside temp. I pushed the reset button, reset everything, and this time the outside temp worked.
customer_reviews.author: ND P.

customer_reviews.title: Fails to do anything it's reported to consistently.
customer_reviews.text: The clock we received has been in 2 locations, our camp and home. It has NEVER updated the time automatically. Recently, it also stopped accurately reporting the outdoor temperature even when the sensor and clock are less than 10 feet from one another. If I could give a zero for accuracy that would be more representative of it's performance. This is an expensive LED clock with no reliable, advertised features at this point.
customer_reviews.author: The Phantom

customer_reviews.title: Amazon Really Needs to Compare Product with Claims and Test Products
customer_reviews.text: This item is about 8" high and 10" wide, so not 12" sq as advertised. The clock doesn't pick up the Atomic time signal, no matter where you put it (I have other clocks in the same location that do) so the time is ALWAYS WRONG. The outdoor temperature sensor doesn't work either. I tried it in the next room and it failed. Placed it right next to the clock and it still failed. I should have read the reviews before I bought it and definitely before I tossed the packaging. Don't waste your money. A true piece of junk!
customer_reviews.author: K. ludwig

customer_reviews.title: Unfortunately....Poor Quality from Sharp
customer_reviews.text: Tried 2 of these clocks. The second was worst than the first. The clock pictured actually supposed to read 10:00 o'clock. I'd say someone needs to work on the pressure of the LED readings. Both clocks in my car to go back as soon as the COVID-19 virus will allow me to go to the shipping store.
customer_reviews.author: Milda Hadaway

customer_reviews.title: Outdoor sensor stopped working
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Sharp clock to replace a previous Sharp for which the outdoor temperature sensor stopped working. This new clock worked for a couple of weeks until the outdoor sensor stopped working. I tried various sets of new batteries: the unit worked for a few days, then off a few, then on, but now seems to have completely stopped, just like the clock I replaced. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Ken K

customer_reviews.title: Love the 3" numerals for time display!
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Arrived in good condition, on-time and as-advertised by seller. Numerals can be seen from across the room!
customer_reviews.author: Smokehouse Dave

customer_reviews.title: Very nice looking clock
customer_reviews.text: The clock is very attractive and easy to read. It took it two days to set itself when we first got it then it suddenly went blank. I removed the batteries and re-inserted them and the clock set itself in no time at all. Since then no problems. So far it has been great. I just hope it lasts.
customer_reviews.author: Dianna Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this clock to replace another brand that I could never get to work. This one was easy to set up & isconnected to the atomic clock.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Good value for money. Very handy item.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this clock. Bought it during quarantine to keep track of the day and date. I like that it does not need to be reset with time changes or power outages. Good quality item. Fast shipping. I would purchase again from this company. It is also a very excellent item for the elderly especially those who have trouble keeping track of the date and date.
customer_reviews.author: Kats

customer_reviews.title: outdor temperature sensor did not work
customer_reviews.text: It was to replace a La Crosse device that was worn out. I decided to try the Sharp products. The outdoor temperature sensor would not work. I am getting a replacement. Next time I will buy the La Crosse. Terry webb
customer_reviews.author: terry webb

customer_reviews.title: The Wireless Outdoor Sensor stopped working or communicating with the main unit after 80 days
customer_reviews.text: The Wireless Outdoor Sensor stopped working or communicating with the main unit after 80 days. It worked for less than 3 months.
customer_reviews.author: N. Lin

customer_reviews.title: Major Rip Off
customer_reviews.text: Bought in September, stopped in November, and it only worked a month, with two sets of batteries, two resets it only worked a month and never a good read out for the outdoor temperature save your money!
customer_reviews.author: Virginia Drake

customer_reviews.title: The temperature inside & out
customer_reviews.text: I dislike setting it up. Thought I had the right time zone, but now I see it is 3 hrs ahead of time. Haven't tried to change it yet, I figure it might take me awhile. Otherwise it is easy to read, nice looking clock.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Save you money
customer_reviews.text: This clock like the LaCross has a malfunction. This outside temp function works for a day or two and then stops working.
customer_reviews.author: Ivrit, Hebrew, Israel, American, Jew

customer_reviews.title: Great producty
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to setup and use. This is my second Sharp branded clock with weather. I would definitely recommend it to anyone needing a clock with weather. The display is large and easy to read from across a room when mounted on a wall. We placed ours on our entertainment center and we can see the time, room temperature and outside temperature at a glance.
customer_reviews.author: Mark E

customer_reviews.title: Defective-update
customer_reviews.text: The atomic part doesnt connect at all and the outside sensor wont connect. The red light flashes but that's it. Updated I raised it up a star because I finally got the outdoor sensor to connect. It's still finicky and off though since it said it was 106F outside all day. It was low 70s. Sometimes it's right though.
customer_reviews.author: DGrim

customer_reviews.title: So good, I bought another one
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these to replace our really old outdoor thermometer, and it's been fantastic. Very accurate, and the clock is easy to read at a glance across the room. in fact even the lower row of date/temperatures are very easy to read. I liked it so much I bought another one for the office.
customer_reviews.author: CoupleOfNutsTop Contributor: Running

customer_reviews.title: Temp Settings
customer_reviews.text: Amazon sent me a new clock as the other one would never work right. I have had this one 2 days and the same thing is happening. Outside temp just goes to -- for no reason. I used new batteries and follow the instruction on the flyer included. I would not recommend this clock to anyone. Sorry
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: The color of the background behind the time and other letters & numbers.
customer_reviews.text: I am actually very disappointed in the clock, and considering sending its back. It's accuracy is excellent. But so dark in color I am unable to read the time or date, without walking over to look at it at very close range, and my eye site is very good. If it had a light color behind the numbers and wording it would make all the difference. Even in a very light room with many windows it is not readable.
customer_reviews.author: Joan

customer_reviews.title: Wish I Would Have Read Reviews First
customer_reviews.text: The only thing 2 things this clock does right is tell time and the time stamp! That's funny being that's what it's supposed to do. I take that as a given. My purchase was based on indoor and outdoor temps. Inside is 10 degrees cooler than actual and outside is 25 degrees cooler than actual. If they only offered it being a clock and cut the price in half it would be a keeper. This one's going back.
customer_reviews.author: Doctor Spin

customer_reviews.title: outdoor  temperature quit working 3 months, not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: The outside temperature sensor has stopped working after only 3 months. I've changed the batteries out twice now and it doesn't fix the problem. The outdoor sensor is shelter under wooden steps where it cannot be rained on. If this is what Sharp quality is all about, I'll never buy another product from them, not for this price.
customer_reviews.author: JKH

customer_reviews.title: Accurate all the time
customer_reviews.text: Actually the first one arrived with a big crack in the face due to improper packing. It was returned, shipping paid by Amazon and a new item received within 2 days in excellent shape. It works great, is easy to read from across the room, and keeps accurate time and tells us our inside home temp, the day, the date and the outside temp as well.
customer_reviews.author: CHERYL L. VALLIS

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: Large numbers make it easy to read from across the room. I was looking for something exactly like this.
customer_reviews.author: PLS

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, defective not worth what it costs
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one I have been sent and each one has a faulty outside temperature Only reads 77 degrees no matter what the temperature is outside I wish I would have seen all the reviews saying temp sensor doesn't work. Surprised Amazon would have a defective product as a sponsored product when over 40% of the reviews are 3 or below
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Plain and simple read out.
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent clock. It's very attractive,nice size (not too big/not too small),and very easy to read. As far as I'm concerned, I can take one quit glance,and find out the weather information I need.
customer_reviews.author: kydave

customer_reviews.title: So easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: It is as easy as putting in the batteries ans setting your time zone, then placing it where you want it. It may take a little time for the signal to come through setting the correct time. Nice big text making it easy to read from across the room.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Kendig

customer_reviews.title: Near perfect clock! Just wish it was also glow-in-the-dark :)
customer_reviews.text: I love how this clock was accurate and easy to install. To be fair, I knew this clock wasn't glow-in-the-dark but i really wished it would've been so that i could clearly see it at any hour of the day. Very nice and modern design. I would definitely recommend it as a gift or personal purchase. I hope to find one that's glow-in-the-dark as close to this clock as possible.
customer_reviews.author: Jojo

customer_reviews.title: This clock is what I expected, but
customer_reviews.text: The instructions were hard to follow. So it took me a while to figure out how to operate. One would think that designers of electronic equipment could figure out easier ways to set up a clock then using complicated buttons and instructions that don't match the buttons.
customer_reviews.author: C. Stevenson

customer_reviews.title: Clock set up very easy, outside temperature not so easy
customer_reviews.text: The product came exactly on the day it said it would. I put the batteries in and the time set very fast on it's own. I didn't have to wait 24 hours like some clocks. So far I haven't been able to get the temperature reading for the outside to work. Will try a couple more times before I say that doesn't work.
customer_reviews.author: Punkinhead

customer_reviews.title: Works well, I especially like the outdoor remote thermometer
customer_reviews.text: Works well, I especially like the outdoor remote thermometer. Hint: for accuracy be sure you place it out of direct sunlight. I have put it on the wall, and the numbers are plenty large enough to be seen throughout the room. Great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Sud Deland

customer_reviews.title: Great clock
customer_reviews.text: Now, this clock will set itself, but you have to be patient. It does need batteries. This is a great clock for old people (like me) you can see it across the room. It gives time, temperature inside, and it’s big! It’s atomic, be patient, it will set itself, I promise.
customer_reviews.author: Annie Mae from Tenn

customer_reviews.title: Atomic Accuracy - always correct!  Never need to reset due to power outage, etc.
customer_reviews.text: Once batteries inserted, in about 2 hours everything was set automatically. #'s are LARGE & easily read from a distance. Color scheme doesn't clash with anything. Sleek design. 2 days after setup, electricity went out 3 times which is rare. Had to reset other clocks & electronic items, but this maintained information and resetting was never necessary. To date, very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Southern Girl

customer_reviews.title: Nice size
customer_reviews.text: We like that the time is extremely large. Unfortunately, the background is so dark it's almost impossible to read the info below the time.
customer_reviews.author: Navy Retired & Happy

customer_reviews.title: Sharp Atomic Clock
customer_reviews.text: haven't had it that long but it seems like a really good clock , the only thing is there is another piece that is suppose to pick up the outside weather and show it on the clock and I can't figure out how to make it work
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: An improvement over earlier models
customer_reviews.text: I bought this clock to replace a very similar one from years ago. This model was able to sync with the atomic clock radio signal right away; I did not have to wait until night. So the radio receiver seems to be a good improvement. The display has inky black digits, but on a background that is not all that bright (gray, not white). Readability, although OK, would be better if the background were lighter.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen R Perrin

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: The clock is easy to set up and connected with WWVB overnight. The directions seemed good. It needs to be in a well lighted place since the screen is low contrast. There are shadow images of the display internals. I have only had it running a few days so I don't know about anything long term.. So far I'm not impressed.
customer_reviews.author: John Whittenberger

customer_reviews.title: Temperature not accurate
customer_reviews.text: Outside temp is actually 96. Display shows 110. It is not in the sun. After noticing this I realized Sharp makes no mention anywhere about the temperature accuracy. I guess they know it is not accurate. I can probably guess the temperature more accurately than this.
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: I love it.
customer_reviews.text: I like this clock with a large display. Even though I have no complaints about the mechanic part of the clock. It would be better if I could change the brightness of the screen. I would like to buy another once that is much larger and lighter color.
customer_reviews.author: M. Scott

customer_reviews.title: Clock with wrong time and day
customer_reviews.text: The clock currently reads 4:13 problem is the correct time is 11:37. Calendar reads 6-1-mon It is 10-14 Wed . Not my first Atomic clock so I am certain the clock isn’t functioning properly.
customer_reviews.author: jerry s. dickinson

customer_reviews.title: Nice clock but does not light up
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this clock first for my visually impaired mother in law I thought it would be big enough for her to see and it also had date etc but when I received the clock it did not light up so she could not use it I think it's a nice clock but did not serve my needs in the picture on Amazon it looks like the clock lights up but it doesn't so I gave it to someone else as a gift.
customer_reviews.author: Terry barbour

customer_reviews.title: OUTDOOR SENSOR FAILED AFTER 2 WEEKS
customer_reviews.text: Received clock and installed it on June 19, 2019. Outdoor temp sensor failed July 7. I've rep[laced batteries and cleaned terminals, switched channels and scanned for signal . . . nothing! I would like to return it for exchange OR just get my money back but don't know how to go about doing either.
customer_reviews.author: Lillian

customer_reviews.title: Time flies... Backwards?
customer_reviews.text: This clock randomly tests itself to 1/22/2018. It also is not back-lit making reading it at any other time than full daylight difficult at best. At this point I can't even be sure the sensor is accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Brass Angel

customer_reviews.title: Poor value
customer_reviews.text: Reviewed a dozen atomic clocks with outside temperature. Ordered this clock...should have returned it immediately. Missed the fact it doesn't have a back light so it is useless in a dark bedroom. The outside temperature works sometimes...help tech says to reset the clock and remote...that works but then after a day or two...it shuts off again. Without constantly resetting, it might work sometimes for a day or two.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy

customer_reviews.title: Keeps loosing time.
customer_reviews.text: We've only had this clock just over a month. I've had to change the batteries twice. My returnee time has passed by a week. I gave it 2 stars, it does work good when it does work.
customer_reviews.author: Lbnewell

customer_reviews.title: Did not work
customer_reviews.text: Clock never acquired Boulder signal to set itself, even in the place that two preceding clocks worked fine. Moved to out doors on porch. Still did not set. Temperature was 8 to 10 degrees F over the other thermometers located in the same place. I do not recommend this. Got a new clock/thermometer and it set the first day and has accurate temperature readings.
customer_reviews.author: Nevadan

customer_reviews.title: Insert batteries, the rest is magic!
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised at how quickly it received the signal and the only adjustment needed was time zone, which is simple. The outside temp. Sensor is very accurate. I couldn't have made a better purchase. The price was very reasonable also.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Only US Time zones -
customer_reviews.text: Just received this clock yesterday. VERY DISAPPOINTED in that the description says 6 time zones. Turns out is has Hawaii TZ but it does NOT include ATL time which is what I need. Found this out after it synced with the signal. Put the outdoor unit 17' from the clock and it dropped the outdoor temperature. Will cost too much to send it back.
customer_reviews.author: AMA

customer_reviews.title: This is one excellent product.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my 84 year old mother she keeps it at her bedside when she knows the temperature inside now and the time of day is big enough she can see without glasses the only thing that would make it better is if it had a little light during the night or button she could push for night time viewing.
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda

customer_reviews.title: Keeps great time. Auto setting
customer_reviews.text: The clock is easy to read and keeps time up to date but the outside temperature reading I never quite right at the time I took a picture of it, it read 90degrees but it was actually 70 not happy with outside temp claim but will keep item 2nd one I’ve had same problem
customer_reviews.author: darrell lee

customer_reviews.title: Easy to read
customer_reviews.text: Right now it’s outside, will need to find away to water proof it. Easy to read from the pool or patio. With temp readings inside and out. If I can keep it dry it’s going to work fine.
customer_reviews.author: MEB

customer_reviews.title: I love Atomic Clocks.
customer_reviews.text: I previously owned an Atomic Clock which got knocked off the wall and broke. It was not user friendly when it needed new batteries in the clock and in the outside temperature sensor. It had to be programmed each time. My new clock was up and running in a couple of minutes with no problem. It is also more attractive than old clock.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Messing up
customer_reviews.text: Time changing after we set it. We have reset it 3 times. The outdoor temp going in and out. Shows temp sometimes and just dots sometimes. Comes and goes. We have moved the sensor, checked the batteries. We threw away the box. What can we do?
customer_reviews.author: Wilma noe

customer_reviews.title: Late for work twice.
customer_reviews.text: Not terribly impressed with this clock. Second time since purchase. This AM woke up late and looked at the clock. The time was off by hours and it was showing May 19th, 2018. Took the trusted old clock out of the closet and I'm back to using it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work. Non existent tech support.
customer_reviews.text: The atomic setting feature did not work. I tried multiple locations including outdoors over several days and it never set itself. I called the company. The call went straight to voice mail. They estimated a return call in 48 hours. I left a message. They never called me back. There is an outdoor and indoor temperature reading. I set the outdoor sensor right next to the unit and the reading was two degrees different than the indoor reading.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: The outside temperature transmitter worked for nearly a week. Since I bought it for accurate time and I don't want to go through the hassle of returning it, I will not return it.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Dickerson

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up
customer_reviews.text: Ordered a second clock as the first one I ordered was a gift for my father in law. He loves it. However this clock did not pick up the outside temp. First one works great, second one I am returning.
customer_reviews.author: clb

customer_reviews.title: Outdoor temp stopped working.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve bought two of these so far, because both times the outdoor temp sensor wouldn’t work! DONT BUY! WASTE of money! But when a new one arrived (thanks amazon) it’ll start working again. Then when I had to replace the batteries on the outside temp sensor, good luck! That’s when it stopped picking up the outside temp. EVERYTHING else works great. But I’m sick of buying this. Going with La Crosse or marathon!!!
customer_reviews.author: Eric J Strandberg

customer_reviews.title: Loses Contact with Sensor
customer_reviews.text: Should've read the review first. This unit also lost contact with the outside sensor repeatedly. Additionally, the outside sensor went through about 3 sets of batteries in a day, so there's obviously an issue with the connectivity of the 2 devices.
customer_reviews.author: Beth Knott

customer_reviews.title: ALMOST WORKS
customer_reviews.text: if YOU ONLY WANT TO TELL THE TIME THIS IS A GREAT CLOCK, BUT I ALSO WANTED IT FOR THE TEMPERATURE SETTINS ..... INSIDE ARE GREAT AND COMPARED TO OTHER INDICATORS, THEY ARE ACCURATE ....... BUT ( THE ALMOST PART ) NO MATTER WHAT I DO OR WHAT SETTING ITS ON THE OUTSIDE TEMPERATURE REMAINS BLANK ... iT DOESN'T MATTER WHERE TRANSMITTER IS AT, 5, 10, OR 15 FEET ... IT STILL REMAINS BLANK ... PROBABLY SENDING IT BACK .....
customer_reviews.author: Ken K

customer_reviews.title: Atomic clock
customer_reviews.text: Nice atomic clock. Easy to set up...just batteries! Just make sure the clock is set to your time zone and the switch is on to auto set. Recommend
customer_reviews.author: Midge

customer_reviews.title: Unfortunately, this product has no backlight and can’t be read from more than 4 feet away.
customer_reviews.text: Manufacturer wants me to take a picture of the weather station and send it to them so they can research possible solutions . Look, I have purchased quite a bit of products from Amazon and am having a problem understanding why Amazon would jeopardize my relationship with them over a $50 item!
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Nice clock. The thermometer works well, and the atomic clock signal connects well. The clock is readable at most angles.
customer_reviews.author: bryan2103

customer_reviews.title: Malfunction after 4 months
customer_reviews.text: We bought this 4 months ago and sadly it no longer works. I replaced the battery twice but it seems there is an issue with the internal connection because the numbers are partially showing. These has been on my night stand and it has not sustain any falls or water damage. It was nice while it lasted but I’m disappointed it did not last longer.
customer_reviews.author: Laurel

customer_reviews.title: Atomic Accuracy??
customer_reviews.text: Where? it never seems to work in Florida. my 1st clock kept resetting to California. this new one doesn't get a signal so much for Atomic Accuracy.
customer_reviews.author: Semi Retired

customer_reviews.title: Flakey and useless.
customer_reviews.text: Only worked for a few weeks. It would reset itself to a random time overnight. The outside thermometer stopped working before the clock quit.
customer_reviews.author: Al Smith

customer_reviews.title: Good item
customer_reviews.text: I am an electronic klutz and I followed the instructions and the clock is doing what it is supposed to do. All this much to my surprise.
customer_reviews.author: Allen D. Martin

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: It took some assembling, but we got it together It was well worth the work. Be patient while it settles in to its new environmen--getting to know what time it is/where it is.
customer_reviews.author: Lydia

customer_reviews.title: Great clock for the money!
customer_reviews.text: Clock was easy to set up. I bought Sharp this time because my previous 2 Atomic clocks sensors didn't last long.
customer_reviews.author: John S Young

customer_reviews.title: Time will not set
customer_reviews.text: It has been days and time will not set. Moved to various areas of house to see it it will work. Need help or will return. ( Edit After three days, finally reset.)
customer_reviews.author: Dianne Stapledon

customer_reviews.title: Time of day with inside/outside temperature a close 2nd
customer_reviews.text: There is nothing about this device that I don't like. The deep black color of the lettering just jumps out at you and as we age that is important for seeing.
customer_reviews.author: Del W Williams

customer_reviews.title: Signal needed help.
customer_reviews.text: I had to take out the batteries and push the reset button to get it to receive the signal to set the clock automatically. I let it try by itself overnight. Works great now.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Co

customer_reviews.title: difficult to set.
customer_reviews.text: Extremely difficult to set. Day (Mon., Tues., etc) is in another language. Outside temperature is never correct. AM time is in military time (18:50 for example), and I cannot figure out how to change that. Want to return it, but vendor says I have to return in original packaging which I did not keep - not knowing that the clock wouldn't work properly. I usually don't buy products with the intention of returning them....
customer_reviews.author: kathleen j. happersett

customer_reviews.title: Love this click
customer_reviews.text: No more having to change the click twice a year with Daylight Savings Time. This clock is so accurate. So glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: SusieQ

product_meta.title: Sharp Atomic Clock - Atomic Accuracy - Never Needs Setting! - Jumbo 3" Easy to Read Numbers - Indoor/Outdoor Temperature Display with Wireless Outdoor Sensor - Battery Powered - Easy Set-Up!!
feature_bullets: Atomic Accuracy: The Atomic clock has a built-in receiver that automatically synchronizes itself with the WWVB radio broadcast by the US Government’s National Institute (NIST) in Fort Collins, Colorado. The Atomic Clock will always be accurate to within one second as it receives daily WWVB updates.

Wireless Outdoor Sensor: The Wireless outdoor sensor (included) transmits the outdoor temperature to the Atomic Wall Clock. The sensor can be placed anywhere within 100ft of the receiving unit. The wireless technology means no wire installation is necessary.
Jumbo 3” Tall LCD Time Display - Easy to Read, Easy to Use, Easy to Set up - Use as either a wall clock, or as a desk clock with integrated stand. Perfect for anyplace in your home.
Displays indoor and outdoor temperature - Displays calendar and day of week
Battery powered: Main unit 3 x AA batteries - Sensor 2 x AA batteries (not included)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars1,353 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
